channel.title: Stats at first log in
channel.description: When I first log in on a new account, the hitpoints is 98/14. I went in Player.Java and found where it is located. I change the XP to level 10 at start and made it so it's 10/10 but it's 10/14

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Good good, sorry I couldn’t help. ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

I changed my code to this:

if (i == 3) { playerLevel[i] = 10; playerXP[i] = 1155; currentHealth = 10; maxHealth = 10; } else { playerLevel[i] = 1; playerXP[i] = 0; } }
Worked

Read full topic

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Try logging in on a different client, perhaps that’s the issue. I’m not too hopeful on that, but shit, it’s worth a go.

Read full topic

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“Scully, post:4, topic:396977”]Well, what you have isn’t much different from what I have. This is a bit intriguing o.O

public Skills(Player player) { this.player = player; for (int i = 0; i < SKILL_COUNT; i++) { levels[i] = 1; exps[i] = 0; } levels[3] = 10; exps[3] = 1154; }[/quote]
It isn’t very different at all is it? I don’t see why mine isn’t working then.

Read full topic

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Well, what you have isn’t much different from what I have. This is a bit intriguing o.O

public Skills(Player player) { this.player = player; for (int i = 0; i < SKILL_COUNT; i++) { levels[i] = 1; exps[i] = 0; } levels[3] = 10; exps[3] = 1154; }

Read full topic

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

I did the update then created a new account. Here’s the only code I could find that has to do with it.

for (int i = 0; i < playerLevel.length; i++) { // Setting Levels if (i == 3) { playerLevel[i] = 10; playerXP[i] = 1154; } else { playerLevel[i] = 1; playerXP[i] = 0; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Stats at first log in
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Did you log onto the same account? If so that’s your problem, if not post the code here, I’ll see if I can help more.

Read full topic
